description: Numbers with an increasing number of nonprime divisors.
links: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..146
example: a(4)=12 because twelve has 4 nonprime divisors {1, 4, 6 and 12} whereas a(3)=8 has only 3; and twelve is the first number greater than eight which exhibits this property.
mathematica: l = 0; Do[ c = Count[PrimeQ[ Divisors[n] ], False]; If[c > l, l = c; Print[n] ], {n, 1, 10^6} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 08 2001
extensions: Alternate description and b-file from _Ray Chandler_, Aug 07 2010
